meanings.sent1: The dimmable lights in the room allowed for a cozy atmosphere in the evening.
meanings.sent2: I prefer dimmable bulbs in my bedroom so I can adjust the lighting to my liking.
meanings.sent3: The dimmable switch was so sensitive that even a slight touch would change the brightness.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a dimmable light, brightening up the room whenever she entered.
meanings.sent5: The sunset painted the sky with dimmable hues of orange and pink.

meanings.definition: Able to have the brightness reduced.
meanings.sent1: The dimmable screen on the phone helped save battery life by lowering the brightness.
meanings.sent2: In the theater, they used dimmable projectors to adjust the brightness during different scenes.
meanings.sent3: The dimmable lamp was a lifesaver when I wanted a softer glow for reading at night.
meanings.sent4: His mood was like a dimmable light, sometimes bright and sometimes dim.
meanings.sent5: The dimmable stars in the night sky twinkled gently above.

meanings.definition: Having the ability to be dimmed.
meanings.sent1: The dimmable feature on the car's dashboard lights made driving at night more comfortable.
meanings.sent2: I love using dimmable candles to create a relaxing ambiance in the living room.
meanings.sent3: The dimmable chandelier in the dining room added a touch of elegance to the evening.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was like a dimmable switch, soothing and calming in any situation.
meanings.sent5: The dimmable moonlight filtered through the curtains, casting a soft glow in the room.
